TopicTitle: Yellowjacket MkII - Compact SSTO that fits inside a MkIII cargo bay - Craft file in descriptions

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-06T18:54:44Z" title="07/06/2015 06:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 6, 2015</time> by trevize1138**

Cool! 

 This reminds me of my ancient Jeb-pod ssto. That thing was so small and like 10 parts or something. How much dv does the ssto have if lifted into orbit?

I've never used any mods to calculate Dv so I can't tell exactly how much it'd have if full in orbit. I'm sure it's enough you could get a Jool encounter from LKO with a full tank. It's just over 13T fully fueled, 10T empty and has around 850 units of liquid fuel if that helps.

Edit: according to [http://www.strout.net/info/science/delta-v/intro.html](http://www.strout.net/info/science/delta-v/intro.html) it's got just over 2000 d/v if fueled up in orbit.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-06T19:05:38Z" title="07/06/2015 07:05  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 6, 2015</time> by trevize1138**
That's very decent indeed. You should try a Munar flyby or minmus, or Duna!

I could certainly do a variant that is Mun/Minmus/Duna capable ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Just the addition of a 3rd jet fuel tank adds a lot more dV. Plus, if I don't need the shielded docking port on top I gain even more with improved aerodynamics. This thing's pretty purpose-built as a stowable Laythe SSTO.
Looks really great, I love tiny ships and it's good to see this is possible ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> I could certainly do a variant that is Mun/Minmus/Duna capable ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Just the addition of a 3rd jet fuel tank adds a lot more dV. Plus, if I don't need the shielded docking port on top I gain even more with improved aerodynamics. This thing's pretty purpose-built as a stowable Laythe SSTO.

That's an awesome idea! It could probably visit a moon or two whilst there. This is my plan when KSP is finally done. To have a highly complex laythe base.

 Post pics when you fly the mission.
